newsitem.title: UK: Texaco's UK Captain oilfield startup delayed again.
newsitem.headline: Texaco's UK Captain oilfield startup delayed again.

text.p: Texaco Inc on Monday said first oil from its British North Sea Captain oilfield development had been postponed again.
Start-up of the 350 million barrel field had been delayed until "some time in February," a company spokesman said.

Captain was expected onstream at the weekend after a delay following an accident at the end of last year at the Spanish shipyard where the field's floating production and storage vessel (FPSO) is being built.
The Texaco spokesman said the latest delay was caused by problems in commissioning the FPSO on the oilfield.
Captain will pump heavy 20 degree API crude and is expected to reach peak production of some 60,000 barrels a day later this year.
Shuttle tankers will carry the crude direct to local refiners or for reloading at Scotland's Nigg Bay.
